choices: It's time to get ready for school
There's no school today, so Cameron just hangs around the house
There's no school today, so Cameron sees if one of his friends is available
Cameron's mother reminds him that they're leaving for a family vacation today
1.content: Cameron yawned as he woke in bed. He groggily mumbled about needing more sleep, and attempted to fall back to sleep. Unfortunately, it seemed that he was wide awake now. He grumpily sat up and climbed out of bed. Deciding to make the most of the situation, he headed to the bathroom to get a shower before either of his sisters got a chance to use up all the hot water. Once clean, he dried himself off, headed back to his room, and got dressed. Now he was ready to start his day.
1.title: The Beginning

11.content: Cameron grabbed his backpack and headed downstairs to grab some breakfast. He toasted himself a bagel, then headed out the door, eating his breakfast as he made the short walk to school. He arrived with plenty of time before his first class, but headed there anyway. His first class was ...
11.title: It's time to get ready for school

111.content:
Cameron made his way to his English class and plopped himself down in his seat. Since no one else was there yet, he rested his head on his desk and zoned out, still feeling tired from waking up so early. He hated days when he had English first since he had no friends in the class. That meant he didn't have anyone to chat with while waiting for school to begin.

Once it came time for class to begin, Ms. Barnes stood up and started class. The class had just recently finished reading through Romeo and Juliet and they were going to be discussing the most recently assigned reading, the final few scenes. Cameron wasn't particularly interested and only slightly listened as they went over the guided reading questions. He tried to pay a little more attention once they got to discussing the work as a whole, since that was stuff they might have to write a paper on.

"Alright," Ms. Barnes said once discussion had wrapped up. "I've got a little assignment for next class. You'll be breaking yourselves up into groups of two to four and selecting a scene to practice and act out for the class."

The students began murmuring as they began talking about who they wanted to work with. Once Ms. Barnes finished explaining the project, and handing out the handout to go with it, she let the class start picking their groups. Cameron hated when he had to pick groups in English since he had no friends in the class. Of course it seemed everyone else did, and they picked out their groups.

"Is there anyone who doesn't have a group yet?" Ms. Barnes asked.

Cameron immediately raised his hand.

"Oh, perfect," Ms. Barnes said. Cameron, Amy, you'll be working together.

Cameron turned in his seat to look at Amy Townsend, the girl who sat behind him. Cameron didn't know Amy very well. She moved to town three years ago and hadn't really made any friends since. She was rather shy and socially awkward, but she did seem nice the few times Cameron had talked with her. She was pretty cute too. She had a nice smile, and shoulder-length light brown hair that she usually kept in a ponytail.

"So I guess we're partners then," Cameron said.

"Yeah," Amy said. "Wanna meet up later and start planning this out?"

"Sure."

Before class ended, Ms. Barnes assigned each group their scenes based on how many people were in the group. Cameron and Amy received the scene where Romeo and Juliet first met. Before heading off to their next classes, Amy and Cameron made plans to meet up after school and go over to Amy's house to work.
111.title: English

choices: Sarah walks back into the room
1111.content:
The rest of Cameron's day passed uneventfully and he met up with Amy after school. On the walk back to her house, Cameron learned more about her. She actually seemed a lot like his friend Jordyn. Despite her feminine and girly appearance, Amy was a bit of a tomboy, Cameron learned. A bit more of a tomboy than Jordyn, but less so than Jordyn's friend Jen and especially less so than Cameron's friend Kat. Cameron thought it was awesome that Amy liked video games and action movies, and other stuff typically thought of as guy things.

The two of them also got along quite nicely and became fast friends. Cameron told Amy that he would definitely introduce her to some of his friends. He felt that Amy would get along well with them, Jordyn especially. He also thought she'd get along well with Jordyn's other friends. Amy was thankful for Cameron's offer. She explained how she had had a really hard time making friends and that Cameron was the first person she'd really clicked with since moving to town three years ago.

By the time they arrived at Amy's house, the two were definitely friends and Cameron was starting to think he had a bit of a crush on Amy. He didn't share that last part with her.

Once inside, the two got to work on reading through their scene a few times. Their scene was, of course, the scene at the party where Romeo and Juliet first meet. The two characters actually kissed in the scene, but Cameron and Amy were just doing a dry read from the book and not acting anything out yet. That said, Cameron did find himself thinking that he wouldn't mind kissing Amy.

A while later, Amy's older sister arrived home. "Hey, Sarah," Amy greeted her older sister who walked into the kitchen wearing heels. "What's with the heels?"

"Oh, you know," Sarah said in a teasing tone. "I need to wear heels more now that my little sister is taller than me."

Come to mention it, Cameron had noticed Amy having quite a bit of a growth spurt in the last year or so. It was dramatic enough that he had noticed even though he never interacted with her much before today. It was a part of puberty after all. Looking at Sarah, Cameron correctly guessed that she would be right around 5'3" without her heels on, making her one inch shorter than himself and Amy. Cameron knew he was short for a guy, but he'd gotten used to it by now.

"Who's your friend here?" Sarah asked, looking over at Cameron.

"Oh, this is Cameron," Amy said. "We got assigned to work on a project together."

"Cameron?" Sarah asked, seeming to recognize the name for some reason. "Like Cameron the boy you have a crush on?"

"Sarah!" Amy shouted in dismay, her face flushing red.

Sarah simply giggled and walked out of the room.

"You have a crush on me?" Cameron asked.

"I, uh, well ... yeah," Amy said, embarrassed. "She wasn't supposed to say that."

"I don't mind," Cameron said. "You're kind of cute, you know."

"Let's, uh, just get back to reading," a flustered Amy said.

And that they did. However, when they got to the kissing part of the scene, Cameron decided to just go for it. He leaned in and gave Amy a kiss, catching her by surprise. After a moment, she relaxed and leaned into the kiss.

And that was how Cameron ended up getting his first girlfriend.
1111.title: After school

11111.content:
For the next few hours, Cameron and Amy practiced reading the script. They mostly just read from the book, but they did make one attempt at memorizing the lines before they finished. It didn't go well. Amy fared a little better than Cameron, who was barely able to remember any of the lines, but they both needed work. That, however, they agreed, would be something they would do tomorrow. They both needed a break.

And so they played some video games together in Amy's room. They both had a lot of fun, and they really felt a connection with each other. Cameron was really glad that they had been given this assignment. He hadn't expected that he would get a girlfriend out of it.

When it started to get close to when Amy's parents usually got home, Amy insisted that Cameron leave. Her dad would be mad if he found out she had a boy over without permission, she explained. Cameron understood, but they planned to meet up again the next day after school to keep working on their assignment, this time at Cameron's house. Plus, they would see each other at school too, and Cameron was going to introduce her to some of his friends. After a goodbye kiss from his new girlfriend and exchanging phone numbers with her, Cameron headed back home in a good mood.
11111.title: A little later

choices: Cameron was still having a little trouble
Cameron was still having a lot of trouble
111111.content:
Later than night, after Cameron had dinner with his mom and sisters and finished his other homework, he couldn't help but share the good news about his new relationship with his two best friends Jordyn and Mitch, and texted both of them. Mitch was very excited for his friend, and a bit jealous that he had gotten a girlfriend before him, especially one who was into gaming. Jordyn was also happy for Cameron. She always teased him about girls and tried to set him up with some of her friends in the past. She knew who Amy was, but like Cameron, she hadn't interacted with her much because she was shy and awkward. Jordyn was definitely interested in getting to know Amy more once Cameron told her that she would like her and that he thought they would be good friends.

After chatting with his friends via text for the rest of the night, Cameron went bed and got a good night's sleep. Then he was off to school the next morning. He didn't have English today, which happened to be his only class with Amy, but they were going to meet up at lunch. The good news was that his first class was History with Jordyn.

"You'll really like her," Cameron found himself saying to his best friend as they waited for class to start.

"You already said that," Jordyn said, playfully punching her friend in the shoulder.

"I know," Cameron said. "But she's just really awesome. We clicked right away."

"God, you're so sappy," Jordyn teased, rolling her eyes.

"Whatever," Cameron said, just before Mr. Daniels began his lecture, boring as always.

After History class, Cameron's next few classes were a bore since none of his friends were in them. Lunch came soon enough. Since it was Thursday, Cameron had first lunch period, as did Amy, which was fortunate. On Thursdays, Cameron's friends Mitch, Kat, and Sam had second lunch period, so he usually ate with Jordyn and her friends Maggy and Jen.

As Cameron suspected, Amy fit right in with Jordyn, Maggy, and Jen, and all three girls seemed to like her. Cameron didn't participate much in the conversation, but he was content to sit with Amy leaning her head on his shoulder as she got to know Jordyn and her friends.

After lunch, Jordyn pulled Amy aside briefly and got a bit serious. "Cam is like a brother to me," she warned Amy. "If you hurt him, you'll have to answer to me."

"He's the first person to ever really take the time to get to know me since I moved here," Amy replied. "I would never."

Jordyn smiled. "Then you have nothing to worry about. Maggy, Jen, and I are hanging out at the mall this weekend. Why don't you join us?"

Amy's eyes lit up. "I would love to! Thanks!"

Walking back over to Cameron, Amy gave him a kiss before heading off to her next class. "So, what do you think?" Cameron asked Jordyn once Amy had gone.

"She's a good fit for you," Jordyn said, patting Cameron on the back. "Don't mess this up, I'm just starting to like her." And with that, she headed out with her two friends in tow.

The rest of the day passed rather quickly, and soon school was over. Cameron met up with Amy outside the building, and they walked back to Cameron's house together, holding hands of course.

"We'll have plenty of time to practice before anyone gets home," Cameron said as he walked into his house with Amy. Cameron's older sister Christina had softball practice after school, his twin sister Anna had some extracurricular club meeting to go to, and his mom would be at work for a few more hours yet.

"Great," Amy said. "Let's get started."

And so the two got to work trying to memorize their lines again. Amy seemed to have a natural talent for it, but Cameron was still having a bit of difficulty. About an hour in ...
111111.title: Later that night

choices: "How about we hang out for a bit?"
1111111.content:
Even after an hour, Cameron was still having a bit of trouble getting his lines down. Their scene was short too, since they were only reading the interaction between their two characters and not the full thing. The class was a bit large, so Ms. Barnes couldn't give each group too much time; she only wanted it to take up one class session after all. Despite all this, Cameron was having trouble.

"Ay, pilgrim, lips that they must use in prayer," Amy said, reciting her line.

"O, then, dear saint, let lips do what hands do," Cameron recited. He then looked to Amy expectantly.

"What are you doing?" Amy asked. "You have another line."

Cameron furrowed his brow in confusion. "Don't you need to say 'Saints do not move' first?"

Amy laughed. "No, silly," she said, playfully hitting Cameron in the arm. "How is it you can remember my lines and not yours?"

Cameron shrugged.

"Remember," Amy continued. "The rest of your line is 'They pray, grant thou, lest faith turn to despair.'"

"If you know my lines so well, why don't you read them then?" Cameron said in frustration.

"You know, that's not a bad idea," Amy said. "The handout Ms. Barnes passed out with the grading criteria said thinking outside the box will get us more points."

"What are you getting at?" Cameron asked.

Amy smirked mischievously. "I'm saying you should be Juliet and I should be Romeo."

"You've got to be joking."

"C'mon, you know this will get us more points. And you're having trouble with Romeo's lines anyway, so maybe you'll have an easier time with Juliet's. Can't we at least try."

"Oh, alright," Cameron agreed. "Let's try it."

Sure enough, for whatever reason, Cameron was able to do better by switching lines with Amy, and Amy had no trouble at all with her new lines. Not too much later, the two of them had their lines down perfect.

"Ms. Barnes will love this," Amy said with excitement. "We'll get an A for sure."

"I sure hope so," Cameron said. "Anyway, now what?"

"Well," Amy said ...
1111111.title: Cameron was still having a little trouble

choices: One of Cameron's sisters interrupts again
They finish watching the movie uninterrupted
11111111.content:
"How about we hang out for a bit?" Amy suggested.

"Yeah sure," Cameron agreed. "What do you want to do?"

"I don't know. What do usually do for fun around here?" Amy asked.

"I usually just play video games when I'm here by myself," Cameron explained. "All my consoles are upstairs if you wanna see."

"Sure!" Amy said enthusiastically.

Cameron led Amy upstairs, then down the hall to his bedroom and showed her inside. He pointed out his TV stand which had all his video game consoles neatly arranged in the compartments below and his television standing on top of it. His collection of games was displayed on a shelf directly to the right of it, all of them sorted by platform and then alphabetically by series.

"Wow," Amy said. "You're really organized."

"Only when it comes to games," Cameron laughed. He pointed to a pile of clothes near the foot of his bed. "I'm a bit of a mess when it comes to everything else."

"Well, you're a lot cleaner than most boys," Amy said, leaning her head on Cameron's shoulder. "I like that about you."

"Thanks, I guess?"

Amy laughed again. "Alright, let's see what games you got here."

And so Cameron and Amy played video games together for a while. Cameron kept thinking about how it was so awesome that he now had a girlfriend that seem to like games as much as he did. He just felt so lucky to have found Amy.

After a couple hours, the two of them got a bit bored and decided to watch a movie together. They headed back downstairs to the family room and Cameron fired up the streaming device hooked up to the TV so they could pick out something to watch. Cameron again felt lucky when Amy picked out an action movie that she said she had been dying to see. Again it seemed like their interests were lining up amazingly well.

Cameron started up the movie and he and Amy settled in on the couch. As the opening credits started to roll, Amy leaned up against Cameron and let him put his arm around her.

---


A little while later, Cameron heard the sound of the door opening, and a few moments later his sisters walked in. "Hey, bro," his older sister Christina said, seeing him on the couch. "Who's your friend?"

"Oh, this is--" he started to say.

"Hi, I'm Amy," Amy cut him off, introducing herself. "Cam's girlfriend."

"About time," Christina blurted out.

"Shut up, sis," Cameron said, shooting her a brief annoyed glance before turning back to Amy. "Amy, these are my sisters, Christina and Anna."

"You're in my Biology class, right?" Anna asked Amy.

"Mhm," Amy replied. "But it's nice to be properly introduced. I didn't know you two were related."

"Yup, twins, actually," Anna said.

"That's neat."

"Well, we'll get out of your hair so you two can enjoy your movie," Christina said, turning to leave. "But it was nice meeting you."

"They seem nice," Amy said once Cameron's sisters had gone.

"Yeah, they're great," Cameron said.

The two then returned their attention to the movie.
11111111.title: "How about we hang out for a bit?"

111111111.content:
As the end of the movie neared, Cameron and Amy had to deal with another interruption, this time when Cameron's mom Helen got home from work. Just like with his sisters, Cameron had to go through the process of introducing his new girlfriend to his mom. After some friendly conversation, and some embarrassing comments about how her boy was growing up, Helen left the kids alone so that they could finish watching the movie in peace.

Shortly after the movie ended, Cameron's mom popped back in again. "Will you be joining us for dinner, Amy?" she asked her son's guest.

"Oh, um, I'm not sure," Amy replied.

"Well, you're more than welcome to," Helen said.

"Okay," Amy said. "Sure. Let me just call my mom first and let her know."

Once Helen left again, Amy pulled out her phone and called her mom. "Hey, mom, I'm staying at a friend's house for dinner if that's okay," she said into the phone. "Okay. Thanks, mom. See you later tonight, then." Amy hung up then gave Cameron a thumbs up. "All good."

---


Not too much later, Cameron and Amy were sitting at the table along with Cameron's sisters, eating dinner and having pleasant conversation. Eventually the topic of Cameron and Amy's new relationship came up. "So, when did you two, well, you know?" Christina suddenly asked.

"Oh, not too long ago," Amy said. "We got assigned a project together and found out we had a lot of similar interests."

"Isn't that nice," Cameron's mom commented. "What sort of project?"

"English," Cameron said.

"We have to learn a scene from Romeo and Juliet," Amy elaborated.

"Oh, Romeo and Juliet," Helen said. "I remember reading that in high school."

Soon the topic changed direction again. Cameron was glad that they didn't need to talk about how Amy was Romeo and he was Juliet for their scene.

Once dinner wrapped up. Amy announced that she needed to head home. Cameron saw her to the door and they parted with a kiss before she headed out. "See you tomorrow, Cameron," she said. "Be sure to brush up on your lines so you're ready for class."

"Don't worry," he replied. "See you tomorrow."

"She seemed nice," Cameron's mom said once he came back inside. "Let her know she's welcome to come by any time."

"Yeah sure," Cameron said, feeling slightly embarrassed. He then headed upstairs to his room.
111111111.title: Cameron's mom gets home

choices: Cameron and Amy head to their next classes
Ms. Barnes asks them to stay briefly after class
1111111111.content:
The next morning at school, Cameron made his way to his English class and plopped himself down in his seat. Amy was there already, sitting in her seat just behind his own, so he turned around the chat with her.

"Ready for our scene?" Amy asked.

"You bet," Cameron replied. He did feel prepared, but he was still a little bit apprehensive about being the girl in the scene. He kept that last bit to himself though.

Cameron did feel a bit better once some of the other groups started. Some groups that were all guys or all girls had scenes with both male and female characters, and he took comfort in the fact that he and Amy weren't the only group playing characters of the opposite gender. However, it seemed they were the only group to do it when the gender ratio of the members matched that of the characters.

Despite the misgivings he had, Cameron still got up and did the scene with Amy when the time came. There were a few snickers from some of the students at first, but for the most part they were all fine with it, especially when they did such a good job reciting the lines. They even did the kiss!

"Great job you two," Ms. Barnes commented when they had finished. "You did a great job memorizing the lines and acting out the scene. I also love how you thought outside the box and didn't go with the obvious choices when selecting who would be which character."

"I told you," Amy whispered to Cameron once they had sat back down.

"You were right," Cameron replies. "Good call."

Glad to be done, Cameron relaxed and watched the remaining groups perform. As far as he could tell, he and Amy seemed to get the most positive critique from Ms. Barnes out of all the groups. At the end of class, Ms. Barnes announced that there wouldn't be any homework for the weekend to give a little break to the students before they started the next book.
1111111111.title: The next day

choices: The rest of the day at school
11111111111.content:
Once class was over, Cameron and Amy parted ways and headed to their respective next classes. The day passed mostly uneventful, and Cameron had a class with Jordyn, and then one with Mitch. Before he knew it, it was already lunch time. Cameron and Amy had the same lunch period again, and they were joined by Jordyn and Mitch too. None of their other friends had that lunch period so it was just the four of them.

It was an enjoyable lunch, and Amy and Mitch got to know each other a bit. Amy also talked about their good performance in English class. Both Jordyn and Mitch were amused that they had swapped who was Romeo and Juliet, but they didn't linger on it, which Cameron was glad about.

Soon the topic changed to the upcoming weekend. Since Amy would be hanging out with Jordyn and her friends on Saturday, Cameron and Mitch made plans to hang out then. It had been a good while since they had done that anyway, so Cameron was looking forward to it. Cameron and Amy also made plans to hang out after school as well, since they wouldn't be spending time together the following day. Before long, the bell rang, and it was time for them all to head off to class.
11111111111.title: Cameron and Amy head to their next classes

111111111111.content:
After school ended, Cameron and Amy met up outside and walked over to Amy's house. Her parents were still at work and her sister Sarah was going to be out with her boyfriend, so they would have the house to themselves for a while, not that they were going to do anything naughty; they were still too early in their relationship for that sort of thing.

As had seemed to become their normal thing to do, the two of them played video games in Amy's room for a while, and then decided to watch a movie together once they grew bored. However, the movie ran a bit long and when it was ended it was later than either of them thought.

"Oh shoot," Amy said. "How did it get so late? You should probably go before my parents get home."

"Why?" Cameron asked. "What's the big deal?"

"It's just my dad," Amy explained. "He's a bit ... overprotective. You should have seen the crap he gave Sarah's boyfriend when they started dating."

Cameron definitely didn't want to deal with that at the moment. "Alright, I'll get ready to go then."

Before he got the chance, Amy's mom walked in the door. "Hi sweetie," she greeted her daughter. "Oh, hello," she then said, seeing Cameron.

"Mom, this is my boyfriend Cameron," Amy introduced him.

"Nice to meet you, Mrs. Townsend," Cameron said, trying to make a good first impression.

"I'm glad my girls seem to gravitate towards nice boys," Amy's mom said, before letting out a little laugh as she turned to Amy. "Even so, I bet your father won't be happy to find out."

"Find out what?" Amy's dad asked, walking into the room, having arrived home just after his wife.

"Hi honey," Amy's mom greeted her husband. "Amy was just introducing me to her boyfriend Cameron."

"Oh great, now both my girls are dating," he said as he sized Cameron up. "What are your intentions with my daughter?"

"Dad!" Amy exclaimed.

"Oh, come on, Bill," Amy's mom said. "Relax. He seems like a nice boy."

"Alright," he agreed. "But I'll be keeping an eye on you."

"Cam was just leaving anyway," Amy said.

"Yeah," Cameron said. "I need to be home for dinner, but it was nice meeting you both."

Amy saw Cameron to the door and gave him a goodbye kiss. "Talk to you later I guess," she said. "Maybe we can meet up on Sunday or something."

"Sounds good," Cameron said. "Bye."

---


After an uneventful end to his evening, Cameron headed to bed. He woke up the next morning looking forward to hanging out with his buddy Mitch. However, it wasn't to be. Shortly before when they planned to meet up, Cameron got a text from Mitch saying his mom was dragging him to some family event for the weekend and he had to bail on hanging out. Cameron wasn't upset about it since he and his best bud would have plenty of other chances to hang out.

Since he was bored and it was still relatively early, Cameron decided to shoot Jordyn a text to see if she had time to hang out before meeting up with Jen, Maggy, and Amy. Since she lived next door, it wouldn't be much of an issue for her to get where she needed to get. Jordyn replied a few moments later saying that Amy had arrived already, but the two of them could head over for a bit if he didn't mind since they were still waiting on Jen and Maggy. Cameron of course didn't mind getting to spend a little more time with his new girlfriend.

A few minutes later, the two girls arrived at Cameron's house and he let them in. As they were deciding what to do, Cameron's mom appeared, looking like she was about to head out. "Oh, hello girls," she said upon seeing Jordyn and Amy.

"Hi, Mrs. Brewer," Jordyn replied.

"Hi again," Amy said.

"Nice to see you both," Cameron's mom said before turning to her son. "I'm going out to run some errands," she said. "If you're planning to go out, don't forget to take your laundry out of the dryer before you leave."

"Don't worry, Mom," Cameron replied. "I won't."

"And why are you still wearing those jeans?" she asked. "They're more torn up than before."

Cameron looked down. His mom was right, one of the legs looked like it was about to tear off at the knee. There was just one problem. "They're the only pair I have left," he said.

"Because you wore them to shreds too," his mom said, letting out a bit of a laugh.

"Hey, I've got an idea," Jordyn said. "Since your plans with Mitch got cancelled, why don't you join Amy, Jen, Maggy, and I at the mall and we can help you pick out some new clothes?"

"What a great idea," Cameron's mom said. "You could do with a lot of new clothes. You've worn out or grown out of a lot of your clothes."

"Sure," Cameron agreed. "It's not like I have anything else going on."

"If you need some clothes, why not take a look in here?" Cameron's older sister Christina said, suddenly appearing, a large cardboard box in her arm. "My friend Lizzie and I collected a bunch of our old clothes we don't want anymore that I'm gonna donate. There's some unisex and boy clothes in here from her tomboy and punk phases she went through a couple years ago that should fit you."

"Yeah, right," Cameron said, rolling his eyes.

"You might as well take a look," Cameron's mom said. "Anyway, I need to get going."

"Bye Mom," Christina said as her and Cameron's mom headed out. She then turned to her brother. "Well all leave this up in your room if you want to take a look," she said before heading upstairs.

"Whatever," Cameron replied.

"Well, we've got time to kill before Jen and Maggy show up," Jordyn said. "Might as well."

"Yeah. C'mon, it might be fun," Amy agreed.

Cameron looked at the two girls, who both looked a bit excited by the idea, and gave it some more thought. After a moment he said ...
111111111111.title: After school

choices: Jordyn intervenes with her own idea
1111111111111.content:
"Alright," Cameron said. "What's the harm in looking?"

"That's the spirit," Jordyn said. The trio then headed upstairs.

Sure enough, when they got to Cameron's room, there was the box Christina had been carrying. "Let's see what we've got here," Jordyn said as she picked the box up and placed it on the bed. She and Amy then began fishing around in it.

"Ah, yes, this will look great on you," Amy said, laughing as she pulled out a black pleated skirt.

Cameron rolled his eyes. "Yeah right."

"Relax, I'm just making fun," Amy said, putting the skirt aside.

"These are cute," Jordyn said, pulling out a pair of lacy panties. "Sure you don't want to try 'em on?"

"C'mon guys," Cameron said. "Be serious about this."

"Okay, okay," Jordyn said. She then spent several minutes rummaging around in the box before pulling out a pair of jeans. "Here we go," she said, tossing them at Cameron. "A pair of boys' jeans. Oh and a couple t-shirts." She passed a few more items of clothing to Cameron. They were two generic logo t-shirts that weren't girls' cut.

"It's something," Cameron said, placing the clothes on the bed. "Anything else?"

"Well, there's these," Jordyn said, holding up a pair of black skinny jeans. "And a couple other pairs."

"Yeah, no," Cameron said.

"Guys wear skinny jeans all the time, you know," Amy pointed out.

"And it's not like these are particularly girly or anything," Jordyn said in agreement. "They're pretty unisex, to be honest."

"You should at least try them," Amy said. "Or maybe a skirt? This one's cute." she then teased, this time holding up a camouflage print miniskirt.

"I'd much rather see you wear that," Cameron told his girlfriend.

"Maybe I will wear it," Amy said, holding it up to herself to check the fit. She then looked back up at her boyfriend, a mischievous smirk on her face. "But only if you try those skinny jeans on."
1111111111111.title: "Alright."

choices: The girls want Cameron to try more clothes on
11111111111111.content:
"Okay, fine," Cameron gave in. "I'll try them on."

"Yay," Amy said before taking the camo-print skirt to the bathroom to change.

"Here you go, champ," Jordyn said with a laugh, tossing the jeans at Cameron.

Cameron sighed, then turned around and pulled his own jeans down. Moments later, he stepped into the black skinny jeans and pulled them up. The first thing he noticed was how tight they were compared to his regular jeans, but other than that, they didn't feel uncomfortable nor that different from his own jeans.

"I guess these aren't so bad," Cameron admitted.

"They look pretty good on you too," Jordyn added.

"I'll say," Amy agreed returning to the room.

Cameron looked over to see his new girlfriend standing in the doorway wearing the camouflage print skirt and holding her skinny jeans in her hands. "And that skirt looks good on you," he said, admiring how she looked in it.

"Aw, thanks," Amy replied. "You really know how to flatter a girl." She walked over and gave Cameron a peck on the cheek before tossing her jeans onto the bed.

"So how about trying on a few more pairs?" Jordyn suggested, holding up another pair of jeans.

"Uh, sure, I guess," Cameron agreed.

And so Cameron tried on a few more pairs of jeans. First, he tried on the pair of regular guy's jeans Jordyn had fished out earlier. After determining those fit, the girls had Cameron try on the rest of the skinny jeans in the box. There was a dark blue pair and a gray pair that were torn at the knees slightly and then there was a red pair that Cameron tried on after the girls had convinced him by showing him pictures of guys wearing similar red jeans. Cameron made his way to his History class and plopped himself down in his seat. Since no one else was there yet, he rested his head on his desk and zoned out, still feeling tired from waking up so early.

Suddenly, Cameron felt a tap on his shoulder. He looked up to see Jordyn, one of his best friends, sitting down next to him. "Hey sleepyhead," she said. Cameron grunted some sort of greeting in response. "What's up?" Jordyn asked.

"Not much," Cameron told her. "Just tired. I don't think I got enough sleep last night."

"You never do," Jordyn said with a laugh. "But at least it's Friday, right?"

"Yeah," Cameron agreed. "At least it's Friday."

The two friends continued to talk as the rest of their classmates began to filter in through the door. Once the lesson began, Cameron started to zone out. He liked history, but Mr. Daniels's lectures were just so boring. He always found it so hard to pay attention. After what seemed like forever, Jordyn tapped Cameron on the arm and passed him a handout, snapping him back to attention. Mr. Daniels was apparently assigning a project.

"You will work in pairs to research a particular topic related to the Byzantine Empire and prepare a report for the rest of the class," the aging History teacher explained. "There is a list of topics on the handout, along with the particulars of this assignment. Now, this time around I want you to move outside your comfort zones and work with somebody new, so I will be assigning your partners."

Cameron and Jordyn looked at each other with disappointed faces. "I guess we're not working together this time," Cameron said.

"Guess not," she replied.

"Alright, here are the pairs," Mr. Daniels continued before listing off the names. After a while, he finally got to Cameron, announcing that he was going to be paired with ...

1121.content:
Cameron sighed as he glanced over at his assigned partner as she prepared to leave. Bethany Andrews was kind of an odd person. She had seemed nice enough in the few exchanges Cameron had had with her in the past, but her gothic fashion sense and the dark and strange stuff she said tended to make most people avoid her. Even though she acted like she didn't care about anyone, Cameron always seemed to get the feeling that she was actually kind of lonely.

When class was dismissed, Cameron got up out of his seat and walked over too Bethany. "So, uh, Bethany," he said to her. "When do you want to start work on this project?"

"Oh, how about today after school?" she asked, turning to face him. As she did so, her shoulder-length raven hair fell down into her face, almost completely blocking it from view. "It's not like I have Friday night plans anyway." She swept her hair back with her black-nailed hand, revealing her heavy black eye makeup and deep maroon lipstick.

"Oh, sure. I don't either," Cameron responded with a slight laugh.

"Great. Here's my address," she said, pulling one of her notebooks out. Cameron couldn't help but notice her apparel as he watched her scribble something on the page. Her outfit consisted of a short and tight black dress with a low neckline and short sleeves, a pair of purple and black striped thigh-high stockings, and a pair of knee-high gothic combat boots with a ton of buckles on them and quite a sizable platform and heel, which made her a bit taller than Cameron. He also noted a black choker necklace with metal studs and a silver chain with what looked like a pentagram hanging from it around her neck.

Bethany finished writing in her notebook, then tore the corner off and handed it to Cameron. "Uh, what does this say?" Cameron asked, unable to read the messy handwriting. His own was pretty bad, but at least he could actually read it.

"Twenty-three Willow Drive," she clarified.

"Okay," Cameron said. "See you later, I guess."

"Cool," Bethany replied before hurrying off to her next class. Cameron followed her out the door and made his way to his next class.

Cameron tossed the thong onto his bed for the time being, then got back to work putting the rest of his clean clothes away. He then returned the laundry basket to the laundry room before figuring out what to do with the thong that had found its way into his laundry.

Thinking they must have belonged to one of his sisters, Cameron went to ask them. His twin sister Anna's room was closer so that's where he went first. 15231121.title: Mrs. Grey appears again

152311212.content:
"Oh, ok well I can wash your dirty ones if you want," Mrs. Grey offered.

Cameron realized he was in big trouble. "Well, they were so dirty that I just threw them away," Cameron said, knowing that he would regret it, "but I'm fine wearing these clothes, and both Anna and Amanda aren't being too painful about it."

"Maybe you should get one of Amanda's unisex jeans instead," Mrs. Grey said.

"Um... we already checked and she had run out. But it's fine, honestly I don't care," Cameron said quickly.

"Well, just as long as you are ok with it," Mrs. Grey said.


Cameron hurriedly thanked her and walked back into the room, closing the door behind him. Anna and Amanda (who was wearing Cameron's jeans and shirt) laughed at him, but stopped when they saw the look on his face. "What happened?" Anna asked.

"Well, Mrs. Grey caught me wearing this and asked me what I was doing," Cameron said, still in complete shock, at what had just happened.

"You didn't tell her we were playing truth or dare, because you know she'll ground me for a week if she finds out," Amanda said nervously.

"No, I said that my clothes got dirty, and I forgot to pack my other clothes, so you let me borrow some of yours," Cameron replied.

"Oh crap. How are we going to get out of this one?" Anna asked.

"Well, if we manage to get Cameron's clothes really dirty, and ask her to clean them for the trip home, and then you can just wear my clothes for until she's finished. We should probably stop playing truth or dare, just to be safe," Amanda said.

"Ok, that sounds alright. I just have to get used to wearing skirts and panties," Cameron said sarcastically.

"I'm sorry Cam, but mum will punish us just as bad as Amanda would be punished," Anna said.

"I know," Cameron sighed, "let's go outside and get this over and done with."

Amanda changed out of Cameron's clothes and into another skirt and shirt. They snuck outside, into the backyard where there was a swimming pool, with a large slide and a small spa in the corner. They found a puddle of mud, and Cameron got his clothes all muddy. He then went inside and gave them to Mrs. Grey who said she'll have them done for the day he left. Cameron then returned outside to where Amanda and Anna were waiting. He stood there embarrassed. "So what do you want to do now?" Cameron asked.

"Why don't we..."

Deciding that he would have a lot of trouble covering up the reason behind wearing a bra, and his desperation to relax in the pool made him take the swim suit out of her hand and walk into Amanda's bedroom to get changed, and allowing him to take off the bra. He was quick to get into the room and take off the shirt and bra he was wearing. He then proceeded to remove his skirt and panties. He the stepped into the swim suit, and pulled it on. It was a little tight but fit ok. He now felt really stupid, staring into the mirror at his reflection. Giving off a sigh, he walked outside where Amanda and Anna laughed hysterically at him. He gave them angry, indignant looks. "Sorry Cam," Anna said, "it's just really weird seeing you this way."

Cameron noticed that Amanda's swim suit was completely black. "Why aren't I wearing the less... girly one," Cameron asked.

Amanda laughed before replying, "do you really think I wanted to wear that?"

Cameron was angry at the injustice served to him. But immediately forgot all about it, as the three slid down the slide, splashed eachother in the pool and relaxed peacfully in the spa, discussing random topics. They were in there for hours, and it was beginning to get late. Eventually Mrs. Grey called them up for dinner. Cameron immediately felt himself blushing as he passed Mrs. Grey in his swim suit. they didn't change, but enjoyed a nice dinner. When everyone had finished, Mrs. Grey then said to him, "I think you should just wear a pair of panties to bed tonight."

Cameron agreed, deciding that it wasn't as bad as wearing a night dress for instance. They all got into bed and the lights were turned off. Cameron was wearing a yellow pair of panties, while his sister and Amanda wore night dresses. They talked for a bit before Anna suggested that they try playing truth or dare, but this time including truth, as dares were some what limited in the dark. "I think we should do one more, before thinking about going to bed," Anna said, "so... Cam let's finish with you."

"I should probably warn you that your cousin Dennis and his mother will be stopping by for a quick lunch," Mrs. Grey explained as she passed the table they were sitting at.

Great! Can u come over now?

Just come over

This story stands on its own, but it is also the second part in a series of loosely related interactive stories that share the same universe.

Rules
No physical transformations. There's some room for minor supernatural/fantastical elements such as hypnosis or things vanishing mysteriously as this story exists in the same world as some of my other stories, just not anything that causes physical transformations through mystical means.
